_accidents.CI_OtherType: Storage vessel put out of service and replaced with an entire different vessel.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

1.  Facility accidental release and emergency response policy.

The management and employees of Illini FS, Inc. are committed to the prevention of any accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia.  If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the Sadorus Fire Department, Champaign County Local Emergency Planning Committee or other authorities, to mitigate any release and minimize the impact of the release to people and the environment.  

2.  The stationary source and the regulated substances handled.

The primary activity at the facility, which is located at 302 E. Market Street, is the storage and blending of fertilizers for sale to farmers.  Anhydrous ammonia is received, stored, and distributed for direct application as a crop production nutrient.  The storage and handling system consists of 1 - 30,000 gallon storage tank, loading risers, associated plumbing and nurse tanks.  Access to the site is restricted to authorized facility employees, authorized management personnel and authorized contractors.

The maximum quantity of anhydrous ammonia that can be stored would be 397,210 pounds, this includes the amount of andydrous ammonia that could be stored in nurse tanks.

3.  The accidental release prevention program.

This facility complies with EPA's Accidental Release Prevention Rule and with all applicable state codes and regulations.  This facility has implemented the provisions of "Safety Requirements for the Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia, K-61.1", published by The American National Standards Institute, Inc. as adopted by state regulation and the standards of the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111, "Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia".  Compliance with these regulations and on-going training of our employees make up our accident release prevention program.

4.  Five year accident history.

The following is a list of accidental releases in the past five yea

rs that have occurred at the facility:

-     We had an accidental release of 15,300 pounds of anhydrous ammonia on 08/17/99.  There was on-site and off-site property damage.

5.  The emergency response program.

The facility has:

-     a written emergency action plan, in accordance with OSHA standard, 29 CFR 1910.38;

-     provided state and local authorities the emergency planning and community right-to-know information as required under SARA Title III (EPCRA).

In the event of an emergency involving anhydrous ammonia, it is our policy to notify the Sadorus Fire Department and Champaign County LEPC and request that they respond to the emergency.  Our emergency action plans have been coordinated with both the fire department and LEPC.

6.  Planned changes to improve safety.

Safety improvement is an on-going process at the facility.  Periodic evaluations are performed to assess the maintenance of safe conditions.  There are no specific safety recommendations for implementation at this time.
